snippet: Antley, a jockey who twice won the Kentucky Derby, was elected to the National Museum of Racing’s Hall of Fame, along with the thoroughbreds Lava Man and Xtra Heat and the trainer King Leatherbury.
abstract: Jockey Chris Antley, two-time Kentucky Derby winner, is elected to the National Museum of Racing's Hall of Fame.
lead_paragraph: Antley, a jockey who twice won the Kentucky Derby, was elected to the National Museum of Racing’s Hall of Fame, along with the thoroughbreds Lava Man and Xtra Heat and the trainer King Leatherbury.

headline.main: Chris Antley Named to Horse Racing Hall of Fame
